data.title: 125 Stars in TOP GUN: MAVERICK movie!
data.meta_description: The J/125 stars in Top Gun: Maverick movie with co-stars Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly enjoying a sail on San Francisco Bay.
data.text:
Stephen Colbert interviews Jennifer Connolly, the co-star with Tom Cruise in the new TOP GUN: MAVERICK movie sequel opening in theaters worldwide this coming Friday, May 27th.

Maverick's (Tom) "love interest" is "Penny" (Jennifer). She's a sailboat owner that Tom offers to help with her "engine problem" (the J/125 offshore speedster).

On his CBS Late Show, Colbert discusses Jennifer's "training" to do her own "stunts"... in this case, Jennifer learns how to sail, then skippers a J/125 sailing on San Francisco Bay with Tom Cruise.

Tom's famous quote: "I don't sail boats, Penny, I land on them!" LOL!

Watch the Colbert/ Connolly TOP GUN: MAVERICK interview here on YouTube

Interestingly, Colbert knows a fair amount about sailing, having first learned how to sail growing up in Charleston, SC. His first offshore experience was sailing the 2005 Charleston to Bermuda Race on a 42-foot cat ketch. Funny as hell description of sailing offshore after both heads (toilets) malfunctioned 2 days into the race! Read about it here on SailingWorld.com

On his CBS Late Night with David Letterman show in September 2005, Letterman had a hilarious interview with Stephen Colbert after his 2005 Charleston to Bermuda Race experience... it's worth a few laughs from any experienced sailor. Watch the Letterman/ Colbert sailing interview here on YouTube.
